definitions.definition: A small house or box, often raised to a considerable height above the ground, and having compartments ( pigeonholes ), in which domestic pigeons breed ; a dove house.
In medieval Europe, a round or square structure of stone or wood, free-standing or built into a tower , in which pigeons were kept.

main_definition: A small house or box, often raised to a considerable height above the ground, and having compartments ( pigeonholes ), in which domestic pigeons breed ; a dove house.
secondary_definitions: ( historical ) In medieval Europe, a round or square structure of stone or wood, free-standing or built into a tower , in which pigeons were kept.
